title.narrative: Emergency livestock support for small-scale farmers in severe flash flood-affected communities in Northeastern districts of Bangladesh

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to increase the resilience among small-scale livestock farmers in flood affected communities through providing emergency support to their livestock. This FAO project provides 1) 30,714 MT of animal feed plus other livestock inputs to 76,785 people, 2) vaccination/deworming/treatment of 15,357 animals and 3) 500 people with agricultural skill training. The project provides life-saving assistance to 76,786 people, including 22,268 women, 21,500 men, 33,000 and 1,206 persons with disabilities.
